reviews.review_msg: Joan is a wonderful, and kind instructor.  Her notes are a little...vague. But she usually allows OPEN BOOK for both midterm and FINAL.  And her exams are MORE THAN fair, with the books open, as her questions are not designed to purposely trick you in anyway.  English is not her first language, but you can definitely understand her.

I agree with the above -- I felt duped into thinking this was an extension of 302.  The prerequisite said 285 OR 302.  302 is a joke stats class, and did not prepare me for 402.  I asked for help with the math, explicitly indicating I did not have matrix math. I was told to drop the course, but if I did, I would be forfeiting a grad school offer :(

Very helpful, but unfortunately very unfair judgment at the end. Its hard to demonstrate you know the material when you can't do the math in the course ... math that SHOULD BE declared via a pre-requisite requirement: MATH 232.
